page.title: 05St. Mary's Church
page.content: This church is found at the south end of Church Road in Willesborough. It is a Church of England church of some importance to the local area. Parts of the building stretch back over 400 years. It is a quiet and holy place where people pray and sing hymns. There are christenings, weddings and funerals. The tall spire is protected from lightning by a copper earthing strip. The spire contains six bells which are rung on special occasions. The Vicar, Rev. N.Brook, was pleased to allow a school party to visit. Although few of the children attend the Church regularly these days, many were interested to see the new organ worth a great deal. They noticed the Chapel of Remembrance for those who died in the Wars. Of special interest were the old graves of the smugglers outside.
